How to move Google Docs, Sheets, or Slides - Dropbox Help How to move Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides Updated Jan 29, 2025 person icon This article is for Dropbox users who have Google files in their Dropbox accounts. If you’ve received an email asking you to configure your preferences for migration, then this article is for you. Learn how to create and share Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides in Dropbox. Dropbox is changing the way that Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides are created and stored in Dropbox. If you’ve created any Google Docs, Sheets, or Slides on dropbox.com, you’ll need to configure your preferences to move or convert in order to maintain access to them. This change will ensure you can use up-to-date Google features while keeping your files organized with the rest of your Dropbox content. There are two options to do so: Move the files to Google Drive (GDrive) and replace them with Dropbox shortcuts. You’ll need to sign in and link to your Google Account in order to move files to Google Drive. This is the recommended option. Your Google files will be automatically migrated to Google Drive and replaced with corresponding shortcuts in Dropbox within 30 days. Convert the Google files (.gdoc, .gsheet, .gslide) to the equivalent Microsoft Office file formats (.docx, .xlsx, .pptx). highlighter icon Note : If you don’t choose an option, your files will be automatically converted into Microsoft Office formats since we are unable to link your Google and Dropbox accounts. How to find Google files in your Dropbox account Use Dropbox search to review your Google files before uploading or converting your documents. To do this: Log in to dropbox.com. Click the search bar at the top of the page. Search for each individual file type: . gdoc , . gsheet , and . gslides . How to move your files to Google Drive To move your files, you can click the button in your email or the banner that pops up on dropbox.com. To do so: Log in to dropbox.com. A pop-up window will appear to move or convert your Google Files. Select Move Google files to Google Drive with shortcuts . Click Next . Click Link Account. Follow the prompts to link your Google account with the same email address as your Dropbox account. Once your accounts are linked, your Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides will be uploaded to a new folder called “Dropbox” on Google Drive and shortcuts to these files will be added to your Dropbox account to replace the original files. How to convert your files to Microsoft Office formats To convert your files, you can click the button in your email or the banner that pops up on dropbox.com. To do so: Log in to dropbox.com. A pop-up window will appear to move or convert your Google Files. Select Convert Google files to Microsoft Office files . Click Next . Your documents will automatically be converted to the equivalent file types in your Dropbox account. If you don’t see the option to move or convert files, you can do so from your account settings. To do this: Log in to dropbox.com. Click your avatar (profile picture or initials) in the top-right corner. Click Settings . Click Apps . Click Configure next to Manage preference and follow the prompts. Admins: How to manage the Dropbox integration with Google Drive If you’re a team or content admin , you can manage which file editing apps can be used by your team. If your team has created any Google Docs, Sheets, or Slides on dropbox.com , they’ll need to choose whether to move their files to Google Drive or convert them to the Microsoft Office equivalents. Moving their Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides to Google Drive ensures your team can use up-to-date Google features while keeping the files organized with the rest of the team’s Dropbox content. Google files can be opened and edited in Google Drive. highlighter icon Note: Google editor will no longer work for opening or editing non-Google files in Dropbox. To continue editing these files, an additional Microsoft Office license may be required. Google files that are in a team folder will be converted to Microsoft Office equivalents since they don’t have a single owner. However, you can move those converted files to Google Drive. To do so: Log in to dropbox.com. Click the name of a converted file to open the preview. Click File in the upper left. Click Save As… . Click Google Doc shortcut . Click Save to use the same sharing permissions as the original file. If you don’t want to keep being asked about permissions, check the box next to Don’t ask me again. If prompted, allow Dropbox access to your Google account. highlighter icon Note: If the Google Drive integration is disabled, your team’s files will automatically be converted to the Microsoft Office equivalents. Learn how to manage apps for your Dropbox team account. Once migration is completed, reports for users and admins will be generated as a .csv file. Admins will see a file titled “Google Migration Report - Admin.csv” in dropbox.com. FAQ What happens to my sharing settings if I move my files to Google Drive? If you move files to Google Drive, the same sharing settings will be applied to your Google files. highlighter icon Note: Some advanced Dropbox sharing settings don’t have direct Google equivalents, such as password protection and shared links accessible to members of your Dropbox team. In this case, we’ll apply only sharing settings supported by Google Drive and keep advanced sharing settings for Dropbox shortcuts created during migration. A migration report named “Google Migration Report.csv” will be added to your Dropbox account with these details. What happens to my sharing settings if I convert to Microsoft Office files? If you convert to Microsoft Office files, existing sharing settings will be respected. How do I know which option is the best? In most cases, we recommend moving your files over to Google Drive and using Dropbox shortcuts. If you use many shared folders or share with non-Google users, we recommend converting to Microsoft Office formats. What happens if I don’t do anything? If you don’t respond to the prompt by the date communicated to you via email, we’ll automatically convert your files into Microsoft Office formats since we are unable to automatically link your Google and Dropbox accounts. What do I do if I get an error message moving files to Google Drive? If any files were unable to be converted, you'll find a report in your Dropbox account titled “Google Migration Report.csv”. We also recommend checking your storage space on Google Drive and then manually uploading documents. Will my documents keep the same formatting after moving to Google Drive? Yes, your documents will keep the same formatting and content after moving to Google Drive. Will permission settings change after moving to Google Drive? You’ll be able to choose whether to apply the same permissions/roles when uploading to Google. If you have any group permissions, they’ll stay the same after your files are moved. Will I still be able to track version history in my documents? Dropbox shortcuts won’t track version history for changes made on Google Drive.  You’ll need to use Google Drive for that. What happens to storage in my Dropbox account? Moving files manually or as a result of the migration will free up space in your Dropbox account, but will impact storage capacity in your Google Drive account. What happens if a file I’m moving has the same name as an existing file in Google Drive? If a file you’re moving has the same name as an existing file in Google Drive, the duplicate file from dropbox.com will have a number appended to the name. For example: “example.docx” and  “example (1).docx”. Can I still open Microsoft files with Google Docs, Sheets, or Slides? You’ll no longer be able to open Microsoft Office files in Google Drive in Dropbox. To continue editing, an additional Microsoft Office license may be needed. Was this article helpful? Change the email address on your Dropbox account - Dropbox Help How to change the email address on your Dropbox account Updated Jan 15, 2025 person icon The information in this article applies to all Dropbox users. The email address associated with your Dropbox account is what you’ll use to log in to Dropbox and receive important Dropbox-related emails. This article explains how to edit the email address on your or a team member’s Dropbox account. If you don’t know what your Dropbox email address is, learn how to find the email address on your Dropbox account . How to change your Dropbox email To change the email address on your Dropbox account: Log in to dropbox.com. Click your avatar (profile picture or initials) in the upper-right corner. Click Settings . Under the General tab, find your email address. Click Edit next to your email address. If you see Verify email instead of Edit , you’ll need to verify your email address before you can change it. If you see an info icon (i inside a circle) instead of Edit , you’ll need to contact your admin to change your email address. Enter your new email, confirm email, and Dropbox password. Click Update email . We’ll send a verification email to your new email address. Open the email, and click Verify your email . Admins: How to change a team member's email address If you’re an admin, you can change the email address on a team member’s Dropbox account. To do so: Log in to dropbox.com with your admin credentials. Click Admin console in the left sidebar. Click Members . Click the name of the team member whose email address you'd like to change. Next to their current email address, click Change and enter the new email address. We’ll send an email to their original email address letting them know that an admin on their team changed their Dropbox email address. Was this article helpful? Connect Google and Outlook calendars to Dropbox - Dropbox Help How to connect Google and Outlook calendars to Dropbox Updated Jan 09, 2025 person icon The information in this article applies to all Dropbox users. You can connect your Google or Outlook calendar and contacts to your Dropbox account. This allows you to share files and folders in Dropbox with your imported contacts. Connect your Google or Outlook calendar and contacts to Dropbox Log in to dropbox.com. Click the grid icon in the top right. Click App Center from the dropdown that appears. Click Google Calendar or Outlook Calendar and Contacts . highlighter icon Note : You can use the Search App Center bar at the top to find the apps. Click Connect , and follow the prompts. Disconnect your Google or Outlook calendar and contacts from Dropbox Log in to dropbox.com. Click your avatar (photo or initials) in the top right. Click Settings . Click the Connected apps tab. Click Google Calendar or Outlook Calendar and Contacts . Click Disconnect . Was this article helpful? Yes, thanks Not really Let us know how why it didn't help: Thanks for letting us know! How to use the Dropbox for Gmail integration - Dropbox Help How to connect Dropbox and Gmail accounts Updated Nov 15, 2024 person icon The information in this article applies to all Dropbox users. You can attach Dropbox files to your Gmail messages, save Gmail attachments to Dropbox, or connect your Dropbox and Gmail accounts with the Dropbox for Gmail Add-on. warning icon In August of 2021, Dropbox ended support for the Dropbox for Gmail Chrome extension. The Dropbox for Gmail add-on is available on any browser or platform, including mobile apps. With the Dropbox for Gmail Add-on, you can: Share your Dropbox files directly through your Gmail account Save attachments from Gmail directly to your Dropbox account Admins can enable the Dropbox for Gmail Add-on for their entire team from within the Google Admin console. Not using Dropbox yet? See how Dropbox makes it easy to send large files. Attach Dropbox files to your Gmail messages To attach a Dropbox file to a Gmail message: Log in to dropbox.com and download the file you’d like to attach to your computer, or download the Dropbox desktop app . Follow the instructions in Gmail Help to attach a file to a Gmail message. Attach the file: If you downloaded it from dropbox.com, you can find the file in the Downloads folder on your computer, in File Explorer (Windows), or in Finder (Mac). If you downloaded the Dropbox desktop app, you can find the file in the Dropbox folder on your computer, in File Explorer (Windows), or in Finder (Mac). Save Gmail attachments to Dropbox To save a Gmail attachment to Dropbox: Follow the instructions in Gmail Help to download a Gmail attachment to your computer . Find the file in the Downloads folder on your computer. Add the file to your Dropbox account on dropbox.com or the Dropbox desktop app on your computer . Install and enable the Dropbox for Gmail Add-on To enable the Dropbox for Gmail Add-on: Click the white plus sign ( + ) icon in the right panel. When you hover over the plus sign, you’ll see Get Add-ons . highlighter icon Note: If you don’t see the right side panel, click the left-facing arrow at the bottom right to open it. Select Dropbox for Gmail . Click Install. Follow the prompts. You may need to log in to your Dropbox account if you aren’t already logged in. The add-on will appear in your Gmail account in the right sidebar, above the white plus sign (+) icon when you open an email with attachments or with Dropbox or Google Drive links. Share files using the Dropbox for Gmail Add-on To share a Dropbox file using the Dropbox for Gmail Add-on: From your Gmail account, click Compose . Click the Dropbox icon at the bottom of the Compose window. Select the file you'd like to share from your Dropbox in the pop-up window. Click Insert link . You'll see the files you selected to share in the body of your email. Save files using the Dropbox for Gmail Add-on To save a Gmail attachment directly to your Dropbox account using the Gmail Add-on: Open an email with file(s) attached in your Gmail account. Click the Dropbox icon in the right sidebar. Select which file(s) you’d like to save to Dropbox. Select where you’d like to save those file(s). Click Save . Was this article helpful? Scan documents using the Dropbox mobile app - Dropbox Help Scan documents using the Dropbox mobile app Updated Jan 10, 2025 person icon The information in this article applies to all Dropbox users, unless otherwise stated. You can use the document scanning feature in the Dropbox mobile app to scan files directly to your Dropbox account or convert existing files to scans. highlighter icon Note: The Dropbox Scan app has been removed from the iOS App Store. If you currently have it installed on your iOS mobile device, you can continue to use it, but it'll no longer be supported. To scan documents on a mobile device, use the document scanning feature in the Dropbox mobile app. How to scan a new file to your Dropbox account To scan a new file to your Dropbox account: Open the Dropbox app on your mobile device. Tap the icon. Tap Scan Document . Take a picture of the content you’d like to scan. If desired, make edits or scan additional pages . Tap Next . If desired, adjust the save settings. Tap Save . Open the Dropbox app on your mobile device. Tap the icon. Tap Scan Document . Either take a picture of the content you’d like to scan, or select an existing image on your mobile device. To redo a scan, tap Retake . If desired, make edits or scan additional pages . You can crop, rotate, or add a filter to the image, as well as add, delete, or rearrange the order of scanned pages. Tap Next . If desired, adjust the save settings. Tap Save . Watch this video for a quick overview of how to use the document scanner. Not using Dropbox yet? Learn all about the doc scanner . How to convert an image in your Dropbox account to a scan highlighter icon Note: The image must be a .jpg, .jpeg, or .png to convert to a scan. To convert an image in your Dropbox account to a scan: Open the Dropbox app on your mobile device. Tap next to the name of the file you’d like to convert to a scan. Tap Save as Scan . If desired, make edits or scan additional pages . Tap Next . If desired, adjust the save settings. Tap Save . highlighter icon Note: You can save a single-page scan as a .pdf or .png. Multi-page scans must be saved as a .pdf. How to edit, arrange, add, and delete pages in a scan After your scan is created, you’ll have the option to adjust the scan from the Edit screen. Within Edit view, you can make the following adjustments: To add additional pages to your scan, tap Add page . Note : Multi-page scans can only be saved as .pdf files. To edit your scan or add a filter, tap the icon with the three sliders at the bottom of the screen. You can crop, rotate, and add either a black-and-white or whiteboard filter to your scan. To reorder the pages of your scan, tap Arrange (beside Edit ) and long press a page to drag and reorder it. To delete pages of your scan, tap the page you want to remove, tap Delete, and then Delete again. Tips for a better scan If you choose to take a picture, point your camera at the object you want to scan. A border outlines the shape you’re scanning. Make sure: Your document isn't crumpled There's no glare on what you’re photographing You hold your device directly above what you’re photographing To include only what you want to scan For Dropbox Professional, Essentials, Standard, Business, Advanced, Business Plus, and Enterprise customers Dropbox Professional, Essentials, Standard, Business, Advanced, Business Plus, and Enterprise customers can search the contents of scanned documents in their Dropbox account (see supported file types below). Dropbox Standard, Business, Advanced, Business Plus, and Enterprise customers who've linked their work and personal accounts also have access to full-text search for their personal account. The following content types are supported: Documents written in English Typed documents The following content types aren't supported: Scans created by a third-party document scanner Documents written in a language other than English Handwritten documents File types other than .pdf Documents with overly stylized text Was this article helpful? How to change or reset your Dropbox password - Dropbox Help How to change or reset your Dropbox password Updated Dec 12, 2024 person icon The information in this article applies to all Dropbox users. If you forgot your Dropbox password or want to change it, you can do so at any time by following the instructions below. highlighter icon Notes : If you don’t have access to the email address associated with your account, learn how to sign in to Dropbox without access to your email address . If you don’t remember the email address associated with your account, learn how to find out which email address is associated with your Dropbox account . If your password has expired, learn how to reset an expired Dropbox password . If you’re a team member on a Dropbox Standard or Advanced team, you may need to contact an admin on your team to reset your password. How to reset your Dropbox password If you forgot your password and can’t sign in, follow the instructions below to reset your password from the login screen: Go to dropbox.com/login . Enter the email address associated with your account. Click Continue . Click Forgot your password? under the Password field. Enter the email address associated with your account. Click Submit . Dropbox will send a password reset link to that email address. Click the link in the email to create a new password. Learn how to create a strong password . highlighter icon Note : If you didn’t receive an email, check your spam or junk folder. If the email isn’t there, add no-reply@dropbox.com to your contacts or address book and repeat the steps to reset your password. How to change your Dropbox password If you can log in, follow the instructions below to change your Dropbox password while logged in: Log in to dropbox.com. Click your avatar (profile picture or initials) in the top-right corner. Click Settings . Click the Security tab. Click Change password . Enter the email address you used to create the account. Dropbox will send a password reset link to that address. Click the link in the email to create a new password. Learn how to create a strong password . highlighter icon Note : If you didn’t receive an email, check your spam or junk folder. If the email isn’t there, add no-reply@dropbox.com to your contacts or address book and repeat the steps to reset your password. Was this article helpful? How to update your Dropbox billing information - Dropbox Help How to update your Dropbox billing information Updated Oct 01, 2024 person icon The information in this article applies to all customers on a paid Dropbox plan. To update your Dropbox billing information, including your payment method, billing cycle, or billing name and address, follow the instructions for your account type below. Learn how to find out what plan you have . Before you update your billing information, here are a few things you should know: If you purchased your Dropbox subscription on a mobile device, you’ll need to manage your billing information through Google Play or iTunes . If you pay by manual invoice or purchased your Dropbox subscription through a reseller, you’ll need to contact support or your account executive to update your billing information. If you’re on Dropbox Plus, learn how to change your organization name on a Dropbox invoice . Dropbox Plus, Professional, Essentials, or Family To add or remove a payment method, or to change a billing name or address for a Dropbox Plus, Professional, Essentials, or Family account: Log in to dropbox.com. Note: If you’re on a Dropbox Family plan, only the Family manager can manage billing information. Click your avatar (profile picture or initials) in the top-right corner. Click Manage account . Click Billing in the left sidebar. Make your changes: To add or remove a payment method, click Update next to Payment Method . To change your billing name or address, click Edit next to your most recent invoice and update your information. Note: You can only change your billing name or address if you’re on Professional or Essentials. Click Save changes . To switch between monthly and annual billing: Log in to dropbox.com. Note: If you’re on a Dropbox Family plan, only the Family manager can manage billing information. Click your avatar (profile picture or initials) in the top-right corner. Click Manage account . Select Subscriptions in the left sidebar. Click Change next to Billing period. Click Confirm . Any change to your billing date will take effect at the end of your current billing cycle. Dropbox Standard, Business, Advanced, and Business Plus highlighter icon Note: This only applies to teams paying by credit card, PayPal, or direct debit. If you pay by manual invoicing, you can only update billing information in the admin console if you’re purchasing additional licenses. To update billing information for a Dropbox Standard, Business, Advanced, and Business Plus account: Log in to dropbox.com with your admin credentials. Note : Only certain types of admins can manage billing information. Click Admin console in the left sidebar. Click Billing in the left sidebar. Make your changes: To add or remove a payment method, click Update under Payment method . To switch between monthly and and yearly billing, click Switch billing period next to Monthly billing or Yearly billing . To change your billing name or address, click the Billing information tab, and then click Update under Business address . Click Save changes . Any change to your billing date will take effect at the end of your current billing cycle. Dropbox Enterprise and Education To update billing information for a Dropbox Enterprise or Education account, contact your account executive or Dropbox Support . Was this article helpful? How to search the contents of your Dropbox files - Dropbox Help How to search the contents of your Dropbox files Updated Feb 27, 2024 person icon Full-text search is only available on Dropbox Plus, Family, Professional, Essentials, Standard, Business, Advanced, Business Plus, and Enterprise. Full-text search allows you to search the contents of your files in Dropbox. When you search your Dropbox files for a keyword, the results will include any files that contain that keyword as well as any files with that keyword in the name. To search the contents of your Dropbox files: Log in to dropbox.com. Click the search bar at the top. Start typing what you’d like to search for. Search results will appear as you type. You can either click one of those results or press the enter (Windows) or return (Mac) on your keyboard to see all results. A text snippet will appear below each search result to show where in the file the keyword is located. Not using Dropbox yet? See how Dropbox helps you effortlessly share files and folders. FAQs about full-text search Which file types is full-text search available for? You can search the contents of the following file types: .doc .docx .docm .gdoc .gsheet .jpg .paper .papert .pdf .png .ppt .pptx .pptm .gif .gslide .rtf .tiff .txt .xls .xlsx .xlsm .vtt Learn more about how to search images in Dropbox. Is full-text search available in all languages? No, full-text search is only available in certain languages. If your search results only include files and folders with your keyword in the name, then the feature isn't available in your language. Does full-text search utilize AI? Learn more about Dropbox AI for search, including how to frame your questions for best results. Read more Was this article helpful? Search your Dropbox files - Dropbox Help How to search your Dropbox files Updated Aug 02, 2024 person icon This article describes a feature available to customers on all Dropbox plans, unless otherwise specified. The search function on dropbox.com and the Dropbox desktop app scans your files and folders to match your search query to relevant file names, extensions, and content . You’ll see your search results load as you type. You can search for the following in Dropbox: File name People who have collaborated on the file Tags File contents (Dropbox Plus, Family, Professional, Standard, Business, Advanced, Business Plus, and Enterprise customers only) Image contents (Dropbox Plus*, Family, Professional, Essentials, Standard, Business, Advanced, Business Plus, and Enterprise customers only) Image properties (such as resolution, date, keywords, copyrights, and other EXIF and IPTC fields) OCR (Optical character recognition) - text within images (Dropbox Professional, Essentials, Standard, Business, Advanced, Business Plus, and Enterprise customers can opt-in) highlighter icon Note: The Dropbox search function isn’t case-sensitive, and may auto-correct search queries to find a better match. How to search your Dropbox files To search your files on dropbox.com: Log in to dropbox.com. Click the search bar at the top. Type in your search query and press enter or return on your keyboard. If the result you’re searching for doesn’t appear automatically, you can filter and sort through results using the dropdown menus above your search results. To search your files in the Dropbox desktop app: Click the Dropbox icon in your taskbar (Windows) or menu bar (Mac) . Click the search bar at the top. Type in your search query. Results that match your query will appear as you type. You can filter results using the Date and Type dropdown menus. highlighter icon Note: If you open a file or folder from your search results that’s not locally synced, it'll open on dropbox.com instead of your Dropbox folder in File Explorer/Finder. To search your files on the Dropbox mobile app: Open the Dropbox mobile app. Tap Search all Dropbox at the top. Type what you’d like to search for. Tap Search or wait for the results. How to filter your search results You can filter your search results on dropbox.com using the following dropdown menus: Folder : Allows you to select specific folders to search inside. Type : Check the boxes next to specific content types to return matches for the following formats: Images Folders Videos PDFs Documents Spreadsheets Presentations Audio Paper docs Other Last modified : Filters search results from the last 24 hours, 7 days, 30 days, 90 days, 12 months, or a custom time period. People : Filters content by people you’ve collaborated with. Image date taken : Filters results from the last 24 hours, 7 days, 30 days, 90 days, 12 months, or a custom time period. Image dimensions : Filters images by pixel size. Small : 500 x 500 or less Medium : 501 x 501 to 1000 x 1000 Large : 1001 x 1001 to 2000 x 2000 Extra Large : More than 2000 x 2000 You can also sort your search results by content that is Most relevant , Newest , or Oldest using the dropdown menu to the right of your filter menus. You can filter search results in the Dropbox desktop app by Date and Type . Date : Filters results from the last 24 hours, 7 days, 30 days, 90 days, or 12 months. Type : Filtering by type returns matches for the following formats: Images Folders PDFs Videos Documents Spreadsheets Presentations Audio Paper docs Other Using advanced search operators You can use advanced search operators to help refine your search. highlighter icon Note : Make sure you’re updated to the latest version of Dropbox Paper to ensure your searches are returning the most accurate results. You can use the following advanced search operators: Search operator Description Example Before or after date You can use dates to find content modified before or after a specific date. Format the date as YYYY-MM-DD. Note : The date is when the file was modified in Dropbox and won’t search images. before: 2022-01-01 after: 2022-12-31 Type Search by type of content: Image Folder File extensions Video PDFs Documents Spreadsheet Presentation Audio Paper Doc type: spreadsheet type: .jpg Title Search for items by their title. Enclose the title quotations marks for exact phrasing or parentheses for any combination of the phrase. Note : The document title may not be the same as the folder or file name. title: (December Invoice) title: "December Invoice" AND This will narrow search results to only files that include both words in them. lead AND new OR This will narrow search results to only files that include either word in them. lead OR new Quotations Use quotations to search an exact phrase for file names. You must use a minimum of two words. “find this phrase in the title” *Customers on Plus can use image search for files uploaded to Dropbox after 6 September, 2023. Was this article helpful? How to use Dropbox AI - Dropbox Help How to use Dropbox AI Updated Mar 13, 2025 person icon This article describes beta features available to select teams in the United States that have explicitly opted in to the Dropbox AI beta group. If you aren’t in the beta group but previously had access to the Dropbox AI features, contact Support to request access. Learn more about AI on Dropbox and your privacy Dropbox AI is subject to additional terms . *Some exceptions apply. Dropbox AI uses generative AI to enhance how you interact with your files in Dropbox, helping you save time and manage content more efficiently. Instead of manually searching through folders or skimming long documents, Dropbox AI streamlines the process by finding answers, summarizing content, and highlighting key details. With Dropbox AI, you can: Summarize documents and videos instantly: Get quick, easy-to-read summaries of lengthy PDFs, reports, and videos, so you can grasp the key points without reviewing everything. Search smarter: Instead of digging through folders, simply ask Dropbox AI a question in the search bar, and it will locate the right files or extract the most relevant details for you. Navigate your content more efficiently: View AI-generated highlights in your search results, helping you find the right file faster without opening multiple documents. How to enable or disable Dropbox AI Log in to dropbox.com with your admin credentials. Click Admin console . Click Settings in the left sidebar. In the Features section, click Enroll next to Dropbox AI . Click Get early access . How to use Dropbox AI in a file preview You can use Dropbox AI in a file preview for the following files: text-based, audio, or video files. To use this feature with a file that someone has shared with you, you’ll need to add it to your Dropbox account. To use Dropbox AI in a file preview: Log in to dropbox.com. Click the name of a file to open a preview. The file must be compatible with Dropbox AI. Click Summarize & Ask . Type your question in the Ask about this file field. Press enter. How to use Dropbox AI for search With Dropbox AI for search, you can ask natural-language questions about your files, and AI will scan your content to provide relevant answers. Instead of manually opening documents or scrolling through files, simply type a question in the search bar, and Dropbox AI can retrieve the most relevant information from your files. To ask a question in the search bar: Log in to dropbox.com. Click the search bar at the top of the page. Type a question or command related to your files. For example: “What are my Q2 financial projects?” “Find my most recent marketing report.” “Summarize my meeting notes from last week.” Click Search . Dropbox AI will analyze the text within your files and return an answer, along with links to the relevant documents. Best practices for using Dropbox AI for search Here are a few things to keep in mind when searching: Be specific with your questions to get the most accurate results. For example,“What are the key takeaways from my project proposal dated January 15?” Use clear, natural language as if you were asking a person. For example, “Summarize the main points from my latest client meeting notes.” Use keywords and commands like, “Find,” “Summarize,” or “Show me.” For example,““Find my tax documents from 2023.” Start your questions with “Who…”, “What…”, “Where…” or “How…” and always end with a question mark (?). For example, “What are my company’s goals for Q2?” What types of files work with Dropbox AI search and previews You can use Dropbox AI for file previews and searches with the following file types: Microsoft Office documents (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) eBooks Video and audio files that contain speech or voice Note: Dropbox generates a transcript for video and audio files if one doesn’t already exist, but it may take a while to generate a transcript before you can ask questions about your file. The answers to questions about video or audio files will be based on the file’s transcript. Raw text files (TXT, CSV, etc.) PDFs with selectable text FAQs about using Dropbox AI Which languages does Dropbox AI work with? The Dropbox AI experience is available in English. How is my data used with Dropbox AI? Dropbox uses third-party generative AI models to power certain AI features. Your data is never used to train their internal models, and is deleted from third-party servers within 30 days. Learn more about Dropbox AI and your privacy . How can I share feedback on Dropbox AI? We welcome your feedback, questions, or suggestions on how we can improve this experience. Join or create a discussion about Dropbox AI on our feedback page . Read more Was this article helpful? How to search for Dropbox Paper docs - Dropbox Help How to search for Dropbox Paper docs Updated Dec 19, 2024 person icon The information in this article applies to all Dropbox users. You can search for your Paper docs, and any docs that have been shared with you, using the search bar in Dropbox Paper. highlighter icon Note: If you’re using the 2020 release of Dropbox Paper , you can find your docs with the search bar in Dropbox and with filters on the Paper Home page. You can also filter your search results on dropbox.com by type. The search bar searches the full text of Paper docs. To find any available doc, you can search for: The title or name of a doc The content within a doc The name of a team member, to see all the docs they've created To access search: Click the search icon (magnifying glass) in any doc. Begin typing in the search bar. All matching docs will be displayed. To access Paper Home from dropbox.com: Click the grid icon on the top left of the page. Find and click Paper . To access Paper Home from any Paper doc, click < next to the document title in the top left of the page. To find any available doc on Paper Home, you can filter by: The name of the person who last updated the doc Docs created by you Starred docs You can start a new search by clicking Clear filters . How to search for text within a Paper doc You can also search for specific words or phrases within an open Paper doc. To search in docs on the web: Type control-F (Windows) or command-F (Mac). Type the word or phrase into the search bar. To search in docs on the iPhone/iPad Paper app: Tap " … " (ellipsis) in the top right. Tap Find in doc . Type the word or phrase in the search bar. To search in docs on the Android Paper app: Tap “ ⋮ ” (vertical ellipsis) in the top right. Tap Search in doc . Type the word or phrase in the search bar. Was this article helpful? Dropbox Replay FAQs - Dropbox Help Dropbox Replay FAQs Updated Dec 09, 2024 person icon The information in this article applies to users with Dropbox Replay and the Dropbox Replay Add-On. This article answers frequently asked questions about Dropbox Replay . Get quick answers to common questions about Dropbox Replay, including common error messages and how to solve issues. What are my Dropbox Replay storage limits? Dropbox Replay is available for all Dropbox plans, but Replay has these additional file limits: Dropbox Basic: 4 files Dropbox Plus: 4 files Dropbox Family: 4 files Dropbox Professional: 4 files Dropbox Essentials : 10 files Dropbox Standard , Advanced , and Enterprise: 4 files Dropbox Business and Business Plus : 10 files With the paid Dropbox Replay Add-On , there is no file creation or upload limit. The storage limit of your Replay files depends on your Dropbox plan storage. Files added to Replay directly from your local drive, Google Drive, Microsoft OneDrive, third-party editing software, or any source other than your Dropbox will count against your Dropbox Replay storage limit and your Dropbox plan storage limit. Files added to Replay from your Dropbox account don't count towards your Dropbox plan storage limit. highlighter icon Note : From May 22, 2024, you can track how much storage space your Replay files are using in the Storage Space breakdown. Only Replay files uploaded on or after that date will use your available storage space. Learn how much storage space your plan includes . Can I buy the Replay Add-On directly in Replay? Yes, you can now buy the Replay Add-On without leaving Replay. Learn more about buying the Replay Add-On . What happens if I delete the original file from my Dropbox account? Deleting, moving, or renaming the original video, image, audio, or PDF file in your Dropbox account won't affect your Dropbox Replay project. The only way a video, image, audio, or PDF file (and its comments) can be deleted from Replay is by directly removing it from your Replay dashboard. highlighter icon Note : If you’re the file owner and you delete your Replay file or project from your Replay dashboard, it can’t be undeleted. If you have the Replay Add-On, you can archive your Replay files and projects instead of deleting them. Who can access files in Dropbox Replay that I imported from Dropbox? You can manage access to your video, image, audio, or PDF files in Dropbox Replay using the sharing settings. When creating shared links for files, you can make them public, private, or share them with specific people. You can also turn shared links off. Learn more about sharing Replay files and projects . If your file is in a team project folder, everyone on your team has access. An admin on your team can take ownership of files or projects shared in the team folder of current and former team members. Learn more about Dropbox Replay admin control features . What happens to Dropbox Replay files if a team member leaves? When a team member leaves, admins have the ability to take ownership of shared files or projects by that team member. Once an admin has taken ownership of a project, they'll be able to take all of the actions that an owner can take, including: Edit, delete, or add a password Toggle downloads on or off Resolve comments Pin or label comments Learn more about Dropbox Replay admin control features. Are there any system requirements for Dropbox Replay? Dropbox Replay runs through the internet browser on your desktop. To ensure the best experience, we recommend using Google Chrome. Learn more about system requirements for Dropbox Replay. I forgot to post my drawings, can I get them back? If you haven’t exited or closed the file you drew in, your drawings on videos will be saved as drafts and marked as empty circles on the video timeline that you can click to view. You can either Post drawing as comment by clicking the paper airplane icon or Delete drawing by clicking the trash can icon. Can I add comments on a file that are only visible to my team? If a project is created by someone with a Replay Add-On, you can leave editor-only comments that won’t be visible to clients or other reviewers. These editor-only comments can only be posted and seen by someone who’s been added to that particular project with edit access or as a project owner. Learn more about adding comments in Replay . highlighter icon Note : Editor-only comments can only be added to projects created by someone with a Replay Add-On, but editors don’t need to have an add-on to leave or review editor-only comments. Why can’t I set a password for my Dropbox Replay file? Password protection is a paid feature included in the Dropbox Replay Add-On. If you were a beta user and you turn off password protection for a file, you won’t be able to turn it back on unless you buy the Replay Add-On. You’ll still be able to edit any existing passwords you'd already set on your files when you used the beta version of Replay or when you had the Replay Add-On. I used to have unlimited files and now I have a limit. How do I find the right files to delete to get under my quota? Only files uploaded after April 25, 2023, count against the file limit, so you can sort your files by creation date and choose which files you’d like to delete or archive. I don’t pay for Dropbox but I want to use Dropbox Replay. What do I do? Dropbox Replay is available to all customers with a Dropbox account, but the Dropbox Replay Add-On is only available to customers on Dropbox Plus, Essentials, Professional, Standard, Business, Advanced, Business Plus, and Enterprise. Can I see comments from previous versions of a file? You can choose to view comments on the current version, all previous versions, or both current and previous versions. Learn more about viewing comments on Replay files . Can I get lossless audio playback on files? Customers who’ve bought the Dropbox Replay Add-On can get lossless HD audio playback for their audio files. Replay supports lossless audio resolutions up to 24-bit/96 kHz. To turn on lossless audio: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Open the audio file you’d like to turn on lossless audio for. Click the Audio quality dropdown. Select Lossless in the dropdown menu. Do I need to buy the Replay Add-On for my whole team? No. Admins on teams who pay by credit card can buy the add-on for specific team members. However, teams that don’t pay by credit card will need to buy a minimum of 10 add-ons for their team. Can I transfer a Replay Add-On from one team member to another team member? Admins can move an add-on from one active team member to another active team member in the Members page. First, you’ll need to remove the add-on from the member that it’s currently assigned to. You can then assign it to another team member. Learn more about managing Replay Add-Ons for team members . Can I add more Replay Add-Ons if I need them? Admins on teams that pay by credit card can buy a new Replay Add-On at any time. You’ll be charged at a prorated amount for the rest of your current billing period. Teams with a dedicated Account Manager will need to contact them directly to request more add-ons. Can a user be assigned a Replay Add-On if they aren’t a team member? No, a Replay Add-On can only be assigned to team members. What happens to your Replay files after you cancel the Replay Add-On? You’ll retain access to all Replay files. You can edit or remove any passwords you’ve set for your files, but you can’t add any new password protection after cancellation. Why can’t I access extended version history, data governance, or advanced security with my Reply Add-On Extended version history, data governance, and advanced security are only available as full-team add-ons, as they apply to the entire team. You can’t access these features with a partial add-on. Was this article helpful? Yes, thanks Not really Let us know how why it didn't help: Thanks for letting us know! Dropbox Replay: an overview - Dropbox Help Dropbox Replay: an overview Updated Dec 09, 2024 person icon The information in this article applies to users with Dropbox Replay and the Dropbox Replay Add-On. What is Dropbox Replay? Dropbox Replay is a rich media review and approval tool that allows collaborators to mark up, comment on, and finalize video, image, and audio projects. With Dropbox Replay, you can create live review sessions for video, image, and audio projects, simplify sharing by sending a link for review, get feedback from anyone through browser-based reviews, and keep track of every version of your projects. To provide feedback directly from your editing tools, Replay also integrates with the following: Adobe After Effects Adobe Premiere Pro Apple Final Cut Pro Avid Pro Tools Blackmagic Design DaVinci Resolve LumaFusion Ready to review and approve video, image, and audio projects with your team? Try Dropbox Replay . Features included with Dropbox Replay Create a live review session Let everyone review and comment on the same video or audio file at the same time — with smooth, high-definition audio and video playback that stays in sync for all viewers. Simplify sharing Send video, image, and audio out for review with a link — no more exporting compressed versions and cluttering your hard drive. Get feedback from anyone Browser-based reviews let anyone provide frame-by-frame feedback and on-screen markups using our annotation tools — no special software or Dropbox account needed. Take action on feedback Send revised versions out for review and respond to comments directly from editors using Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premiere Pro, Apple Final Cut Pro, Avid Pro Tools, Blackmagic Design DaVinci Resolve,  and LumaFusion. Keep versions under control Track every version of your video, image, and audio projects, including comments and markups for each in one place. View comments from previous versions Retain unresolved comments from previous versions, to track and review feedback over time. Export Replay comments Export comments from Replay in the following formats: XML, FCP XML, JSON, CSV, CSV (condensed), Plain text, or Avid Media Composer text. The Dropbox Replay and Avid Pro Tools integration also allows you to take comments from a review session and export them directly into your Pro Tools project . The Dropbox Replay Add-On The Dropbox Replay Add-On offers premium features for Dropbox Replay , including password protection for shared links, autogenerated video transcription and captions, large file transfers, and archiving to Dropbox. Dropbox Replay Add-On - Dropbox Help The Dropbox Replay Add-On Updated Dec 09, 2024 person icon This article describes a paid add-on available to customers on Dropbox Plus, Professional, Essentials, Standard, Business, Advanced, Business Plus, and Enterprise. The Dropbox Replay Add-On offers premium features for Dropbox Replay , including due dates, password protection for shared links, a links page, video transcription and captions, large file transfers, and archiving to Dropbox. How to get the Replay Add-On Individuals can buy the Replay Add-On by going into their Manage account settings in Dropbox. If a team’s payment method is credit card, team admins can buy add-ons in the admin console. Teams with a dedicated account manager or teams that don’t pay by credit card will need to contact us directly. Learn how to buy and manage Replay Add-Ons . highlighter icon Note : Teams or individuals on a trial cannot buy the Replay Add-On. They must upgrade to a paid subscription before buying the add-on. Features included The Dropbox Replay Add-On includes all the features in Dropbox Replay , plus the following: Due dates : Set due dates for each file for collaborators to give feedback in a timely manner and keep your projects on track. Password-protected links : Password-protect your shared links for all your files and projects. Links page : Manage all your shared links to files from one place. Video transcription & captions : View auto-generated transcriptions and closed captions for videos. Archive to Dropbox : Archive your work to Dropbox and keep your Replay workspace clutter-free. Large file transfers : Increase the size limit of Dropbox Transfers to 250 GB. Large file previews : View and comment on large file previews up to 150 GB in Dropbox Replay without having to download or open them in the original application. Lossless audio : Playback and experience better quality of your audio files in Dropbox Replay. Video version comparison : Review and compare two versions of the same video project in a side-by-side view. Watermarking : Create a customized watermark onto image and video files and track the IP address, date, and time a viewer opens your file. Editor-only comments : Add comments that can’t be viewed by clients or external reviewers. Project logos and banner colors : Create a customized logo and banner color for your projects, or choose a preset option. highlighter icon Note: Customized logos can be any image file that you can preview on Dropbox, and must be at least 80x80 pixels with a maximum size of 100 MB. Dropbox Replay is turned on by default for all users, but it only offers limited access and limited file uploads to Replay. Depending on your plan, you’ll be limited to four or ten file uploads. Learn more about Dropbox Replay storage limits With the Replay Add-On, there’s no file creation or upload limit. Find answers to frequently-asked questions about the Dropbox Replay Add-On . Buying the Dropbox Replay Add-On - Dropbox Help How to buy and manage the Dropbox Replay Add-On Updated Dec 09, 2024 person icon The information in this article applies to customers on Dropbox Plus, Professional, Essentials, Standard, Business, Advanced, Business Plus, and Enterprise. This article describes how individuals and teams can buy and manage the Dropbox Replay Add-On. The Replay Add-On offers premium features for Dropbox Replay , including password protection for shared links, autogenerated video transcription and captions, large file transfers, and archiving to Dropbox. highlighter icon Note : Individuals or teams on a trial cannot buy the Replay Add-On. They must upgrade to a paid subscription before buying the add-on. Learn more about the Replay Add-On . Buy or remove Replay Add-On for individuals To buy or remove the Dropbox Replay Add-On for your personal account: Log in to dropbox.com. Click your avatar (profile picture or initials) in the bottom left corner. Click Manage account . In the Add-ons section, click Add or Remove next to Replay Add-On . Note : If you don’t see any add-ons, click View all add-ons to expand your choices. Click Confirm . You can also use the Buy Replay notifications or banners in Replay to buy a Replay Add-On. When you buy the add-on, you’ll be charged at a prorated amount for the rest of your current billing period. At the start of your next billing period, you’ll be charged for the full amount of the add-on in addition to your subscription cost. Buy or remove Replay Add-On for teams that pay by credit card If your team’s payment method is credit card, you can buy or remove add-ons in the admin console. highlighter icon Note : If your team isn't paying by credit card, but you don't have a dedicated Account Manager, you’ll need to contact us directly. You may be eligible to buy a minimum of 10 Replay Add-Ons for your team. How to assign a Replay Add-On to a team member To buy a new add-on for a team member: Log in to dropbox.com with your admin credentials. Click Admin console . Click Members in the left sidebar. Click No add-ons under Add-ons , next to the person you want to assign an add-on to. Click Add beside Replay in the pop-up that appears. Click Buy now . Once assigned, No add-ons will change to Replay under Add-ons . How to remove a Replay Add-On from a team member To remove an add-on: Log in to dropbox.com with your admin credentials. Click Admin console . Click Members in the left sidebar. Click Replay under Add-ons , next to the person you want to remove the add-on from. Click Remove beside Replay in the pop-up that appears. Click Confirm . Once removed, Replay will change to No add-ons under Add-ons . highlighter icon Note: You have the option to assign the add-on to another team member after removing it. If an add-on remains unassigned on your next renewal, it will be permanently removed. How to buy or remove Replay Add-Ons for multiple team members To add or remove add-ons for multiple team members: Log in to dropbox.com with your admin credentials. Click Admin console . Click Members in the left sidebar. Check the box beside Name , which will select all team members. Uncheck the box beside any members that you don’t want to include. Click Add add-ons to add multiple team members, then click Confirm . Click Remove add-ons to remove multiple team members, then click Confirm . How to request a Replay Add-On from your team admin If you’re a member of a team and want to be assigned a Replay Add-On, you can request one from your team admin. Go to dropbox.com/replay . Scroll down and click Buy the Replay Add-On . You’ll be asked to log in to your Dropbox account to send the request. Click Request add-on . You’ll see a notification that says the request was sent. You’ll get an email if it’s approved. highlighter icon Note : Admins will receive a notification via email, in their Dropbox account notifications, in the admin console Dashboard , and in the admin console Members page. How to cancel Replay Add-Ons Replay Add-Ons will automatically be canceled if they remain unassigned at the end of a billing period. This avoids any unnecessary billing of teams. For example, if a team member with an add-on leaves the team but their add-on isn’t assigned to another team member, this add-on will be cancelled when you renew. Buy or remove Replay Add-On for teams with an Account Manager If your team has a dedicated account manager, you’ll need to contact Dropbox directly to buy Replay Add-Ons for your team. Your team must buy a minimum of 10 add-ons, but you don’t need to buy them for the entire team. Once you’ve bought the add-ons, team admins can assign or remove them in the admin console. How to assign or remove an add-on To assign or remove an add-on for an individual team member: Log in to dropbox.com with your admin credentials. Click Admin console . Click Members in the left sidebar. Find the person whose add-ons you want to update, then assign or remove the add-on under Add-ons . Click No add-ons if you’d like to assign. Click Replay add-on if you’d like to remove. Click Add or Remove next to Replay Add-On in the pop-up that appears. Click Confirm . highlighter icon Notes : You’ll see your team’s total number of unassigned add-ons beneath Replay Add-On in the pop-up. Once removed, Replay will change to No add-ons under Add-ons . How to assign or remove multiple add-ons To assign or remove add-ons for multiple team members at once: Log in to dropbox.com with your admin credentials. Click Admin console . Click Members in the left sidebar. Check the box beside the people who need add-ons assigned or removed. Hover over someone’s name to make the checkboxes appear. Click Add add-ons or Remove add-ons , depending on what you’d like to do. Click Add or Remove beside Replay Add-On in the pop-up that appears. Click Confirm . highlighter icon Notes : To assign or remove add-ons for your entire team, check the box beside Name , then follow the steps above. To assign or remove add-ons by group, click the dropdown beside Group , select the group you want, then follow the steps above. How to manage files and projects in Dropbox Replay - Dropbox Help How to manage files and projects in Dropbox Replay Updated Dec 09, 2024 person icon The information in this article applies to all Dropbox Replay users. You can add files and create projects in Dropbox Replay, including adding updated versions of project files. Once uploaded or created, you can manage viewer access and permissions for your files and projects. How to add files in Dropbox Replay To add files to Dropbox Replay: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Click Add files in the top right. Select Dropbox , Local drive , Google Drive , or Microsoft OneDrive . Choose the file or files you'd like to add. Note : You can upload multiple files at once from Dropbox or your local drive, but only one file at a time from Google Drive or Microsoft OneDrive. Click Add or Open . Once the upload is complete, a thumbnail of your file will appear under Home . highlighter icon Notes: Dropbox Replay files are stored in your Dropbox account. If you have a large file or project you’d like to upload to Replay, make sure you have enough available storage space. To cancel uploads that are in progress, click Cancel next to the file name in the upload drawer at the bottom of the Replay window. Local uploads that are canceled or fail to upload can be retried by clicking Retry next to the file name in the drawer at the bottom of the Replay window. This isn't available for Dropbox, Google Drive, or Microsoft OneDrive files. If you’ve reached your uploads limit, you’ll see an Out of uploads error message when you try to upload a file. How to rename a file or project To rename a file or project: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Hover over the file thumbnail or the row of the project you’d like to rename. Click “ … ” (ellipsis) in the top right. Select Rename from the menu that appears. Type in the new project name. Click Rename . How to create a new version of a file in Dropbox Replay To create a new version of a file: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Hover over the thumbnail or row of the file you’d like to add a new version to. Click “ … ” (ellipsis) at the end of the row or in the top right. Hover over New version . Select Dropbox , Local drive , Google Drive , or Microsoft OneDrive . Choose the file you'd like to add. Click Add or Open . highlighter icon Notes : Once the upload is complete, the number of file versions will refresh in the thumbnail or row of the file (Example: V2 ). To view previous versions, click on the file, then select a version in the Versions dropdown in the upper left. After you create a new version, you can still view resolved and unresolved comments on previous versions of the file. This lets you track and review feedback over time. Learn more about viewing comments on Replay files . How to delete a file in Dropbox Replay highlighter icon Note : If you’re the file owner and you delete your Replay file or project from your Replay dashboard, then it can’t be restored. If you have the Replay Add-On, you can archive your Replay files and projects instead of deleting them. To delete a file: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Hover over the thumbnail or row of the file you’d like to delete. Click “ … ” (ellipsis) in the top right. Click Delete from the menu that appears. Click Permanently delete when prompted to confirm. highlighter icon Note: This will delete all versions of the file, including the shared links and comments. How to delete a version of a file in Dropbox Replay highlighter icon Note : Deleting versions of a file in Dropbox Replay is permanent, and you can’t recover that version or any comments in it. If you have the Replay Add-On, you can archive your Replay files and projects instead of deleting them. To delete a version of a file: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Click the file you'd like to delete a version of. Click the V[#] dropdown menu in the top left. Note: This will be marked by the version that’s open (Example: V2). Click “ ⁝ ” (vertical ellipsis) next to the version you’d like to delete. Click Delete this version . Click Permanently delete [version name] . highlighter icon Note: You can also Delete all versions from this menu. How to create projects in Dropbox Replay To create a project: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Click Create project in the upper right. Enter a project name in the box and a project description if required. Click Create . Your new project will open once you click Create . How to add files to a project in Dropbox Replay To add files to a project: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Open the project you want to add files to. Click Add files in the upper right. Select Dropbox , Local drive , Google Drive , or Microsoft OneDrive . Choose the file or files you’d like to add. You can multi-select files from Dropbox or your local drive, but can only upload one file at a time from Google Drive or OneDrive. Click Add or Open . Once the upload is complete, a thumbnail of your file will appear in the project folder under Home . To send a file to Dropbox Replay without adding it to a project: Log in to dropbox.com. Right click the image, video, or audio file you want to add to Replay. Click Send for review . Once your content is sent to Dropbox Replay, you can move it to any project that you’re working on. highlighter icon Notes : If you copy an existing Replay file and move it into a new Replay project folder, no comments or notes in the existing file will transfer into the new project. To cancel uploads that are in progress, click Cancel next to the file name in the upload drawer at the bottom of the Replay window. Local uploads that are canceled or fail to upload can be retried by clicking Retry next to the file name in the drawer at the bottom of the Replay window. This isn't available for Dropbox, Google Drive, or Microsoft OneDrive files. If you’ve reached your uploads limit, you’ll see an Out of uploads error message when you try to upload a file. How to delete a project in Dropbox Replay To delete a project: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Hover over the thumbnail or row of the project you’d like to delete and click “ … ” (ellipsis) in the top right. Click Delete from the menu that appears. Click Permanently delete when prompted to confirm. highlighter icon Note: All editors will lose access and deleting this project will permanently remove all files and related activity, as well as project folders. Learn how to share and manage access to files and projects in Dropbox Replay . How to download all files in a Replay project To download all files in a project: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Open the Replay project you want to download. Click the download icon (arrow pointing down to a line) at the top, then select one of the following: Only the latest version of files Only files with “Approved” status All files and versions in this project Click Download . Open the Replay project you want to download. Click the download icon (arrow pointing down to a line) in the top right, then select one of the following: Only the latest version of files Only files with “Approved” status Click Download . Notes : The maximum number of files that can be downloaded as a .zip file is 10,000. You can’t download all files in a project as a .zip folder if the total size is greater than 250 GB. How to download files or proxies in Replay You can download the original file, or download proxies that are lower in size and resolution. To download the latest version or all versions of a file: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Hover over the thumbnail of the file you’d like to download and click “ … ” (ellipsis) in the top right. Click the download icon (arrow pointing down to a line) at the top, then select one of the following: Only the latest version All files, including all versions To download a file or files in lower resolutions or sizes: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Hover over the thumbnail of the file you’d like to download and click “ … ” (ellipsis) in the top right. Click the download icon (arrow pointing down to a line) at the top, then select one of the following: Download original : Download the file in its original size Download proxy : Choose a proxy in the resolution you want Download all : Download all the available proxies at once in a .zip file How to manage your Replay storage Files added to Replay directly from your local drive, Google Drive, Microsoft OneDrive, third-party editing software, or any source other than your Dropbox will count against your Dropbox Replay storage limit and your Dropbox plan storage limit. Files added to Replay from your Dropbox account don't count towards your Dropbox plan storage limit. Learn more about Dropbox Replay storage limits . How to check the size of a Replay file To see how much storage space a single file is using: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Click the file you want to check. Click the file info icon (the letter “i” in a circle) in the top right. How to archive files in Dropbox Replay If you have a Replay Add-On, you can archive your Dropbox Replay video, image, audio, and PDF files, including their comments, to your Dropbox account. This allows you to delete archived video files from your Home page in Replay, so you only see active project files. highlighter icon Notes: Only files can be archived. Entire projects can’t be archived. Dropbox Replay users who don’t have a Replay Add-On can’t archive files, but they can download files to their local drive. To archive Dropbox Replay video, image, audio, or PDF files: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Hover over the thumbnail of the file(s) you’d like to archive. Check the checkbox that appears in the upper left. Click Archive to Dropbox at the top of your Home page. Select a folder you’d like to archive files to, or click Create folder . All folders will show as empty even if they contain files. If you don’t choose a folder, your file will be archived to your All files tab in your Dropbox account. Check the box next to Only archive the latest version of Replay file , if you’d like. If you don’t check the box, all versions and comments will be archived to the folder. Click Choose . Your Replay video, image, audio, or PDF file will appear in the designated folder of your Dropbox account. How to share and manage access to files and projects in Dropbox Replay - Dropbox Help How to share files and projects in Dropbox Replay Updated Dec 09, 2024 person icon The information in this article applies to users with Dropbox Replay and the Dropbox Replay Add-On. Once you add files or create projects in Dropbox Replay, you can share them with collaborators. You can also manage sharing permissions, viewer and comment access, download ability, and password protection. Admins have access to all Replay team files and projects. Learn more about Dropbox Replay admin control features . highlighter icon Note: Password protection and Add due date are paid features included in the Dropbox Replay Add-On. How to share files in Dropbox Replay To share a video, image, audio, or PDF file in Dropbox Replay: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Hover over the thumbnail or in the row of the file you’d like to share. Click “ … ” (ellipsis) in the upper right. Click Share from the menu that appears. Note: You can change all your file permissions from your Links tab if you have the Dropbox Replay Add-On. Select recipient access: View and comment: Collaborators can view the file and comments, and can add comments of their own. View only: Collaborators can view the file, but can’t see or add comments. Note : Click Manage settings to require a password, hide past comments, require a Dropbox login, enable downloads, or enable link access. Click Send or Copy link . Paste the link where you’d like to share it. highlighter icon Note: Links to files will display the title of the file as well as a thumbnail preview and a short description of Dropbox Replay. How to share or add people to projects in Dropbox Replay To share or add people to a project in Dropbox Replay: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Hover over the file thumbnail or row of the project you would like to add people to. Click “ … ” (ellipsis) in the upper right. Click Add people . Enter the emails of the people you’d like to add. Notes: Adding users to a project gives them control over the whole project and everything in it. You can only add a user to your project via email. You can enter groups or teams you already made in your Dropbox account. Learn more about managing Dropbox Replay for your team . Add a message, if you’d like. Choose Can edit or Can comment , depending on the permissions you’d like to grant. Click Add . highlighter icon Note: You can also add people directly from your folder, by clicking Add people in the upper right. Your collaborator will receive an email invitation to open your project. If you’d like to collaborate on a project in real time, start a live review session instead. Learn how to use live review in Dropbox Replay . How to enable or disable link access to your shared file To enable link access to your shared file: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Open the file you’d like to enable link access to. Click Share in the top-right corner. Click Manage settings . Check or uncheck the box beside Enable link access . highlighter icon Note: To turn all your shared links on or off, click the View and comment or View only tabs. How to hide previous versions of a shared file or project To only allow people to see the current version: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Open the file you’d like to enable link access to. Click Share in the top-right corner. Click Manage settings . Check the box beside Hide past versions . How to delete a user from your project To delete a user from your project: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Click their avatar (profile picture or initials) at the bottom of the project thumbnail. Click the dropdown menu next to their name. Click Remove . highlighter icon Note: To make sure someone can’t access any files in a project, turn off all your shared links under the view and comment or view only tabs. You can also password-protect your files and project to prevent access with the Dropbox Replay Add-On feature. How to password-protect your shared links If you have the Replay Add-On, you can password-protect your shared links: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Hover over the thumbnail or row of the file or project you’d like to share. Click “ … ” (ellipsis) in the upper right corner. Click Share from the menu that appears. Click Manage settings . Check the box beside Require password . Enter the password in the box that appears and click Save . To edit an existing password, repeat steps 1 to 5 then click Edit password (under Require Password ) to update the password. How to add a watermark to your shared link If you have the Replay Add-On, you can apply a default or customized watermark to your Dropbox Replay videos. A default watermark link can be sent to your groups or teams, or you can add email addresses and send a new customized link for each email address. If your Replay file has a default watermark, you’ll see Watermark in the top-right corner of the thumbnail image. Replay files with customized watermarks have the same setting options as a default watermark, but also include email tracking and record the IP address, date, and time of each view. To add a watermark: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Open the Replay file you’d like to add a watermark to. Click Share in the upper right. Select the Watermark tab. If you haven’t created a watermark yet, click + New Link . Under the Customize tab, you can adjust these settings: Display text Custom text Position Theme Opacity Size Click the Settings tab and adjust the settings, if needed. Click Save . Click the Copy link. You can then paste the link with the watermark into an email, message, or anywhere people can access it. How to add a due date to your shared link If you have the Replay Add-On, you can add a due date for collaborators to encourage them to deliver timely feedback on your shared media file. You can only set one due date per file. To add a due date: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Open the file you’d like to add a due date to. Click Share in the upper right corner. Click Add due date and select a due date and time. Click Save . This due date will be visible to collaborators when they view the file in Replay. highlighter icon Note: When a due date is set, you'll receive one email reminder 24 hours before the due date. How to manage your shared links from your Links page If you have the Replay Add-On, you can manage your shared links for files and projects from your Links page in Dropbox Replay. You can also see file type, the date the file was created, who has access to your link, and the type of access they have. To manage access to your files and projects: Log in to replay.dropbox.com. Click Links . To change access to a link, toggle Link access on or off. To share a specific version of a view only link, hover over the link address, click Copy to Clipboard and select which version you wish to send. Click Close. Was this article helpful?
